reviewText: This is currently my favorite show on TV.  I love the concept and the way Amy Allan is so dedicated to her task--really keeps herself out of it as much as possible and goes through a lot in order to help people and places undergoing paranormal activity.  Season 1's been out for about a year, now.  When will Season 2 be coming?

reviewText: I'm 64 yrs old and have been interested in the paranormal all my life.  I know about the Shadow People and the true Lizi Borden story.  This show is 7 star excellent.  Not for children.  I await for the next release, please hurry up!!!

reviewText: Do the dead really haunt the earth? I don't know, but I really enjoy this show because it's not silly and crappy like a lot of other paranormal shows out now.  Steve is awesome, straight forward and simple, Amy is more out of the box and extremely interesting. I always watch the show at night! Scary! Another really good paranormal show that is currently in syndication is The Haunted .. very good.This show is set us like investigation combining reality with the paranormal, researching the history of a location. The sketches are the best!

reviewText: Dead Files is a favorite of mine.  I use the DVR to record the episodes to watch and re-watch.  I was so happy to find season one and eagerly await the release of more.

reviewText: But I don't really get the guy that walks around with Amy...he's there just to push her to talk and not just stand there watching the spirits? But then..there is another guy filming that guy (sorry I cannot remember his name that holds the small camera).. I think it's great that we get to see Amy's stroll mixed in with the investigations and putting all the points together. Amy's facial expressions are priceless, so much emotion. I love how cynical the cop always sounds when doing the investigations, because you know he's got to believe by now. But still keeps that perfect cynicism in his interviews

reviewText: I greatly enjoy this show. You will too. It's not the typical ghost hunter show. Amy Allen is believable. This isn't your typical medium. Worth the cost.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I only watch 2 ghost shows, this and Ghost Adventures. I love Amy and Steve! This is perfect since you get to see some history and then find out what Amy is hearing from the spirts still waiting around. I know so many people are saying this stuff is fake and that is fine, but I enjoy watching it anyway. What better way to spend some time on a weekend then hanging around the tv watching shadow people or what ever speaking to Amy while we watch Steve hunt down the history of what happened in years past to the building or land around a hunted place. I love being able to pull out the older episodes and watching them again. I just can't wait for the newer seasons to come out to DVD since I don't have cable or dish to watch the shows on.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A lot of these shows are scripted. I believe this is one of them here is why, 1 Amy often tells clients tarot cards are bad and  lure evil spirits to your home. This is fear based hogwash and any one that actually learned how to read them knows this is not true. Tarot cards don't rely on spirits unless you call on spirits. Mostly they rely on your higher self. 2, she told a client her Reiki pratice was wrong. Why would an evil spirit be drawn to positive healing energy? It wouldn't it would flee.She uses voodo tar water, has recomended a wiccan for one house, a medicine man for another, a catholic execercisim for another.Basically Amy can be a psyic and an expert in all things psyic and you can't. She is a know nothing know it all. I don't belie any real psyic would tell the people half the crap she says.
summary: Any Allen is wrong I think it's scripted

reviewText: Often miss understood medium, Amy Allen enters into the etherial realm of the dead through the personality of a young girl's spirit to reveal to the viewer events from the past with sobering accuracy.  I have personally seen her talent displayed when she revealed to me the truth behind the death of a young woman in my dental office which became an episode on the program.  I did not reveal to her or anyone else everything that I knew, but through her interaction with the dead girl, Amy learned more than I knew.
